intro: Tephroseris subdentata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features include a woody base and a branching structure that allows it to thrive in challenging environments. Tephroseris subdentata is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub ecosystems.
